CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 5, 1952, pg. 4, reads: "'Carver Week' Proclaimed - Mayor David L. Lawrence is pictured signing the 'Carver Week' Proclamation in his office last Wednesday while members of the sponsoring committee look on. They are, left to right: Mrs. Alma Illery, national president of the Achievement Clubs, Inc.; Mrs. Willa Mae Simpson, vice president; Mrs. Sarah E. Marcus, Mrs. Lillian Friedburg, co-chairman of the local observance; Mrs. Willa Mae Rice, publicity; Dr. Robert Milikin, local chairman; Mrs. Carrie Young chairman of ways and means; H. H. H. Henius publicity chairman. A member of the younger generation scrutinizes the Mayor's signature more closely. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of the City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Lillian Friedburg, Alma Illery, and Dr. Robert Milikin, looking over the shoulder of Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence signing document, behind table in Office of the Mayor at City County Building
